name: AWS default password policy
description:
#### AWS default password policy

When creating a new [IAM user](https://aws.amazon.com/iam/) in your AWS account, the default [password policy](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_passwords_account-policy.html#default-policy-details) enforces the following conditions:

- Minimum length of 8 characters and a maximum length of 128 characters
- Password must include a minimum of three of the following mix of character types:
  - Uppercase letter from the Latin alphabet (A-Z)
  - Lowercase letter from the Latin alphabet (a-z)
  - Numbers (0-9)
  - Non-alphanumeric characters `! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + - = [ ] { } | '`
  
For example, the following passwords are not valid:
1. `Short1` password length < 8 characters
2. `OnlyUpperLowerCase` password only include upper and lower case characters, but missing numbers or non-alphanumeric characters
3. `paris2024` password only includes lowercase characters and numbers, but not upper case or non-alphanumeric characters
4. `London;2025` password contains invalid non-alphanumeric character `;`

Howerver, the following passwords are valid:
1. `Beverly_Hills_90210` password length is within accepted range, and it includes both upper/lower case characters, numbers and non-alphanumeric characters
2. `ValidPassword!` password length is within accepted range, and it includes both upper/lower case characters and non-alphanumeric character

Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is the write a function that will get a password to evaluate, and return true if the password is valid (false other wise)
